question:
Consider the following diseases:
  1. Guinea worm
  2. Yaws
  3. Maternal and neonatal tetanus
  4. Cattle plague
Which of the above has/have been eradicated from India as per WHO?
explanation:
• India officially received certificates from World Health Organisation (WHO), declaring the country yaws and maternal and neonatal tetanus free in 2015.
  • India has internationally been declared as free from Rinderpest or cattle plague, a fatal viral disease that hits livestock population.
  • Indian Government started implementation of National Guinea Worm Eradication Programme (GWEP) in 1983-84 which helped India to become a guinea worm free country by the year 2000.
